avalancheActivity.comment:
The new snow represents the main danger. This snow can be released easily or naturally in all aspects above the tree line.
Distinct weak layers exist deep in the snowpack on shady slopes. Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released in isolated cases by winter sport participants in particular on very steep west, north and northeast facing slopes.
Dry avalanches can in very isolated cases be triggered in the old snowpack and reach quite a large size on very steep shady slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The new snow represents the main danger. Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released in some places on shady slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment: The old snowpack will be prone to triggering in some places. Towards its surface, the snowpack is unfavourably layered and its surface consists of loosely bonded snow lying on a melt-freeze crust. Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche prone weak layers exist in the old snowpack on northwest, north and northeast facing slopes. Avalanches can in some places be released in the old snowpack by a single winter sport participant. This applies in particular in little used terrain at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example. Such avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on very steep shady slopes above the tree line. Such avalanche prone locations are barely recognisable, even to the trained eye. Mostly the avalanches are medium-sized.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Weak layers in the old snowpack are treacherous.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Faceted weak layers exist in the bottom section of the snowpack especially on west, north and east facing slopes. These can only be released in isolated cases.
At elevated altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.

avalancheActivity.comment: Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released especially by large additional loads in particular on steep shady slopes. This applies in particular in little used terrain, as well as in areas where the snow cover is rather shallow above the tree line. In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard crust.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Weak layers in the lower part of the snowpack represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: The old snowpack will be subject to considerable local variations in some places. Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak.

tendency.highlights: Above approximately 1000 m snow will fall on Friday. The wind will be moderate to strong. Gradual increase in danger of dry avalanches as a consequence of new snow and wind. Above approximately 1800 m danger level 2 (moderate) will be reached.
